Find meetup groups matching a search query

find_groups.Rd

Find meetup groups matching a search query

find_groups(
  text = NULL,
  topic_id = NULL,
  radius = "global",
  fields = NULL,
  api_key = NULL
)

Arguments

text

Character. Raw full text search query.
topic_id

Integer. Meetup.com topic ID.
radius

can be either "global" (default) or distance in miles in the range 0-100.
fields

Character. Optional fields that are not returned by default.
api_key

Character. Your api key. Defaults to checking your environment for a parameter called "MEETUP_KEY" via Sys.getenv("MEETUP_KEY"). This key can be obtained from https://secure.meetup.com/meetup_api/key/. To set the environment variable run Sys.setenv(MEETUP_KEY = "PASTE YOUR MEETUP KEY HERE").

Value

A tibble with the following columns:

  • id

  • name

  • urlname

  • created

  • members

  • status

  • organizer

  • lat

  • lon

  • city

  • state

  • country

  • timezone

  • join_mode

  • visibility

  • who

  • organizer_id

  • organizer_name

  • category_id

  • category_name

  • resource

References

https://www.meetup.com/meetup_api/docs/find/groups/ https://www.meetup.com/meetup_api/docs/find/topics/

Examples

if (FALSE) {
api_key <- Sys.getenv("MEETUP_KEY")
groups <- find_groups(text = "r-ladies", api_key = api_key)
groups <- find_groups(topic_id = 1513883, api_key = api_key)
groups <- find_groups(text = "r-ladies", fields = "past_event_count,
 upcoming_event_count", api_key = api_key)
past_event_counts <- purrr::map_dbl(groups$resource, "past_event_count",
 .default = 0)
upcoming_event_counts <- purrr::map_dbl(groups$resource, "upcoming_event_count",
 .default = 0)
}
